perturbation.original_text:
3. Consideration.  In consideration of the sponsorship rights and other services    -------------
and products granted and provided to Sponsor by FNW hereunder, Sponsor hereby
agrees to pay FNW a sponsorship fee in the amount of Forty thousand Dollars
($40,000 net) (the "Sponsorship Fee").
perturbation.changed_text:
3. Consideration.  In consideration of the sponsorship rights and other services
and products granted and provided to Sponsor by FNW hereunder, Sponsor hereby
agrees to pay FNW a sponsorship fee in the amount of Forty thousand Dollars
($40,000 gross) (the "Sponsorship Fee").
perturbation.explanation: The definition of 'Sponsorship Fee' is changed from 'net' to 'gross.' This creates uncertainty about whether taxes or other deductions are to be applied to the stated amount. This could result in disputes over the actual amount owed.

perturbation.original_text:
7. Termination.  FNW and Sponsor shall each have the right but not the
----------- obligation to terminate this Agreement upon forty-five (45) days prior written notice, without further liability except as otherwise provided by this Paragraph 7 if any of the following shall occur:

            (a) Damage to or destruction of the Kingdome to the extent that the
                 Kingdome is closed for a period of greater than thirty (30)
                 days, in which case the refund provisions of this Paragraph 7
                 shall apply.
perturbation.changed_text:
7. Termination.  FNW and Sponsor shall each have the right but not the
----------- obligation to terminate this Agreement upon forty-five (45) days prior written notice, without further liability except as otherwise provided by this Paragraph 7 if any of the following shall occur:

            (a) Damage to or destruction of the Kingdome to the extent that the
                 Kingdome is closed for a period of greater than sixty (60)
                 days, in which case the refund provisions of this Paragraph 7
                 shall apply.
perturbation.explanation: The clause regarding termination due to damage to the Kingdome is modified to require a closure period of sixty (60) days instead of thirty (30) days. This contradicts the original 30 days, creating confusion about when termination rights are triggered and potential disputes about refund eligibility.

perturbation.original_text: 5.2. Use of FNW and Seattle Seahawks Trademarks.  Sponsor shall not, by this         ------------------------------------------         Agreement, obtain any right, title or interest in the trade names or         trademarks of FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL Enterprises, L.P.,         NFL Properties, Inc. or any affiliate of such, nor shall any such         agreements give Sponsor the right to use, refer to, or incorporate in         marketing or other materials the names, logos, trademarks, designs,         identifications or copyrights of&bbsp;FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL         Enterprises, L.P., and NFL Properties, Inc. without the prior written         approval of FNW, which approval may be withheld in FNW's reasonable         discretion. Sponsor may use Seahawks trademarks for promotional purposes         as necessary to convey the Sponsor benefits described herein. However,         all such rights shall expire at the end of the 1999 regular season.
perturbation.changed_text: 5.2. Use of FNW and Seattle Seahawks Trademarks.  Sponsor shall not, by this         ------------------------------------------         Agreement, obtain any right, title or interest in the trade names or         trademarks of FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL Enterprises, L.P.,         NFL Properties, Inc. or any affiliate of such, nor shall any such         agreements give Sponsor the right to use, refer to, or incorporate in         marketing or other materials the names, logos, trademarks, designs,         identifications or copyrights of&bbsp;FNW, the Seattle Seahawks, the NFL, NFL         Enterprises, L.P., and NFL Properties, Inc. without the prior written         approval of FNW, which approval may be withheld in FNW's reasonable         discretion. Sponsor may use Seahawks trademarks for promotional purposes         as necessary to convey the Sponsor benefits described herein. These rights shall extend through the 2000 regular season.
perturbation.explanation: The expiry date for using Seahawks trademarks is changed from the end of the 1999 regular season to extending it through the 2000 regular season. This directly contradicts the previous statement, creating confusion about the duration of trademark usage rights and opening the door to disputes regarding trademark infringement after the initial expiry date.
